subhead: Following the attack on two National Guard soldiers in Washington, US authorities have stepped up announcements aimed at immigrants, raising the prospect of a possible 'remigration.'

title: Francis Ford Coppola auctions his watches after  'Megalopolis' disaster
subhead: The American filmmaker will auction off several collector's items by F.P. Journe, Patek Philippe and Breguet on December 6 and 7, in an attempt to offset the losses from the box-office failure of his latest film.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)

title: Christophe Gleizes: The life on hold of a French journalist imprisoned in Algeria
subhead: Aged 36, Christophe Gleizes has been held in Tizi Ouzou for more than five months. Arrested in Kabylie while reporting on a football club, he was sentenced in June to seven years in prison for 'glorifying terrorism.' His appeal trial opens on December 3.
byline: By Brice Laemle and Simon Roger

title: Mexico's new Frida Kahlo museum bends the truth
subhead: Since opening to the public this fall in Mexico City, a new museum devoted to painter Frida Kahlo has sparked a series of controversies. Contrary to claims by its owners, the house was never the home of the Kahlo family, and a mural discovered on site was likely not the artist's creation.

title: Gay Talese, the last titan of the American press
subhead: He was a pioneer of New Journalism, a movement that transformed American journalism with a literary writing style. At 93, the author of the landmark 1966 profile 'Frank Sinatra Has a Cold,' finds his daily life increasingly constrained by old age.
